snippet: The two workers stranded 827 feet in the air on Wednesday said they began their morning the way they always did: performing security checks.
abstract: Juan Lizama and Juan Lopez, window washers who were stranded 827 feet in air on side of 1 World Trade Center, recount their initial panic when half of their work platform stopped rising; duo, who knew they had performed all appropriate safety checks before beginning day's job, say they then remained calm until rescuers arrived.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and BENJAMIN MUELLER

lead_paragraph: The two workers stranded 827 feet in the air on Wednesday said they began their morning the way they always did: performing security checks.

headline.main: Window Washers, in Trouble at World Trade Center, ‘Just Grabbed On’
headline.print_headline: Window Washers, in Trouble at Trade Tower, ‘Just Grabbed On’
